summary: The Habitat Connectivity on Working Lands Act of 2025 amends the Food Security Act of 1985 to improve wildlife habitat connectivity and migration corridors. It defines habitat connectivity and big game species, modifies conservation programs to prioritize habitat connectivity, increases payments under certain programs, incorporates nonstructural methods like virtual fencing in conservation practice standards, and encourages habitat corridor conservation. It also provides for research and extension grants focused on virtual fencing technology.
